moves.1. e4: I start out with my normal opening
moves.1... e5: she responds with the normal too
moves.2. Nf3: i go with my right to begin my minor pieces development
moves.2... d5: what is name of this gambit?
moves.4... f5: no protection in row 7  c d e for the king
moves.6. Nxe5: took that free pawn. Has not started development yet.
moves.6... Kf6: never seen this before that the other player moves only the king  in the start game.
moves.8. Bd3+: check. never seen a game like this before.
moves.8... Ke6: is this chance when a king in this wide open on the board. is better to castle and develop or get a checkmate without doing the normal stuff.
moves.9. O-O: castle  even so I am sure that  this player will not try to attack me
moves.9... c5: bad move.  my thought is that black should get the king protected and start development to try to save her self
moves.10. Bc4+: check no safe place to go
moves.10... Kf5: this leads into a other check
moves.11. Qd3+: gets another piece in the game
moves.11... Kxg4: blacks does not know  what she is doing.
moves.13. Qe4+: keeps on putting pressure on that king.
moves.13... Kh5: you can not get anywhere in chess by only moving king and pawns.
moves.14... Bg4: wow moves another  piece other than the king. did not see that coming at all.
moves.17. Bc4+: keeps on making black  to move back
moves.17... Be6: has some sense to move that bishop
moves.18. Qh5+: I just realize i have double attack on the king  one last move with the bishop and this move with that queen
moves.19. Nd2: is it ok that i am not fully developed this late in the  game
moves.19... Ke7: king is not in wide open any more
moves.20. Qg5+: but not all the way safe
moves.21. Ne4+: have whites pieces near the black king on all sides
moves.26. Qxd7: took bishop before black takes my queen
moves.28. Qd6+: keeps a close eye on the king
moves.30... Kb7: ops i never finished develop my minor pieces
moves.32. Qf7+: i all focus on a checkmate  and  forget about finished getting my last minor piece out
moves.33. Rd1+: getting the rook in to the game
moves.34. Qc7+: at least i  keep black in check for the rest of the game
moves.34... Ke4: blacks does not know that every move it takes will lead to a check
moves.35... Kf5: do  not get into a stalemate
moves.39... Kf7: with all this moving up and down f row is  it a 3 move draw.
moves.41... Kh5: there can be a  possible checkmate here but can not find it
moves.42... Kg6: if i kept that king in that area a checkmate
moves.49... Kg7: king maybe if i check rook e7
moves.50... Kf6: maybe if move that queen  it could  be a checkmate
moves.51. Qf8#: I win. I never had a game like this before
